text:
1001 to 07 Park Avenue, at, adjoining and north of the N. E. corner of East 84th Street, as photographed forming a background for a truck snow plow. East 84th Street is on the right and the corner building is No. 1001. The two frame buildings are to the north of same. Note the fenced area in the center of Park Avenue, dividing traffic into two lanes.

About 1925
Views 1,2

Gift of Albert A. Volk Co.

(1) Neg # 479

Perk Avenue, at north east corner of 84th Street, showing four houses to be demolished in 1928.
Nos. 1003 and 1005, the small ones in the middle, are the last two frame houses on Perk Avenue below 100th Street.
See Underhill's larger photograph of the same corner May 1928 before demolition.

November 19, 1927.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

Nc# 671

Park Avenue, at S.W. corner of 84th Street, showing Church of St. Ignatius Loyola (Jesuit).

January 31, 1928.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

Park Avenue, at N. E. corner of 84th Street, showing Nos. 1003-05, the last two frame houses on the avenue below 100th Street, about to be demolished to make room for 1001 Park Avenue, co-operative apartment house built by T.E. Rhodes Co.

May 17, 1928.

Irving Underhill, Photographer.
